```{r}
#| label: load-packages
#| warning: false
#| message: false

library(tidyverse)
```

Let's first load the data:

```{r}
#| label: load-data
#| eval: false

nobel <- read_csv(file = "data/nobel.csv")
```

Then let's split the data into two:

```{r}
#| label: split-data
#| eval: false

stem_cat <- c("Physics", "Medicine", "Chemistry", "Economics")
# stem laureates
stem <- nobel %>%
  filter(category %in% stem_cat) 

stem_1 <- nobel %>%
  filter(category == stem_cat)

# non-steam laureates
non_stem <- nobel %>%
  filter(!(category %in% stem_cat ))

#non_stem_1 <- nobel %>%
 # filter(!category == stem_cat)

```

And finally write out the data:

```{r}
#| label: write-data

write_csv(stem, file = "data/nobel_stem.csv")
write_csv(stem_1, file = "data/nobel_stem_1.csv")
write_csv(non_stem, file = "data/nobel_nonstem.csv")

# add code for writing out the two data frames here
```
